**The Candle of Eternal Flame** is the [Flame Mage](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is the prize for completing the [Flame Mage quest](/wiki/Flame_Mage_quest "Flame Mage quest"), and is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") for wishing purposes. Its base item is a [magic candle](/wiki/Magic_candle "Magic candle").

## Generation

For Flame Mages, The Candle of Eternal Flame is always guarded by their quest nemesis - the [High Ice Mage](/wiki/High_Ice_Mage "High Ice Mage") in Hack'EM and the [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage") otherwise - and is placed on their square atop the [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") in the center of the lair on the Flame Mage quest goal level.

If the artifact is generated in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file that is discovered by a Flame Mage, it will always be replaced with its mundane base item.

## Description

As indicated by its name, The Candle of Eternal Flame is always lit, and carrying the artifact grants [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") and [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"). [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The Candle of Eternal Flame summons a [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [fire elemental](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental") - in SlashTHEM, it has a 1⁄4 chance of summoning a tame [greater fire elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_fire_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater fire elemental (page does not exist)").

## Strategy

In SLASH'EM, the Candle of Eternal Flame and its slotless properties are fairly convenient to have for Flame Mages: warning can cover the gaps in extrinsic [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), and teleport control can be handy if dealing with [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") from eating [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu") and [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth") corpses; cold resistance can be obtained intrinsically from various sources, making it the most easily superseded property. Fire elementals are generally not remarkable as post-[Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") pets, so the invoke effect is typically not of much use. A light source that is never put out by, e.g. [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") or [rust traps](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap") is a major plus as well. For other neutral roles, this artifact is generally not worth using a wish on.

The Candle of Eternal Flame is the Flame Mage quest artifact in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is the prize for completing the Flame Mage quest, and is neutral for wishing purposes. Its base item is a magic candle.

Generation

For Flame Mages, The Candle of Eternal Flame is always guarded by their quest nemesis - the High Ice Mage in Hack'EM and the Water Mage otherwise - and is placed on their square atop the altar in the center of the lair on the Flame Mage quest goal level.

If the artifact is generated in a bones file that is discovered by a Flame Mage, it will always be replaced with its mundane base item.

Description

As indicated by its name, The Candle of Eternal Flame is always lit, and carrying the artifact grants warning, teleport control and cold resistance. Invoking The Candle of Eternal Flame summons a tame fire elemental - in SlashTHEM, it has a 1⁄4 chance of summoning a tame greater fire elemental.

Strategy

In SLASH'EM, the Candle of Eternal Flame and its slotless properties are fairly convenient to have for Flame Mages: warning can cover the gaps in extrinsic telepathy, and teleport control can be handy if dealing with teleportitis from eating tengu and giant shoggoth corpses; cold resistance can be obtained intrinsically from various sources, making it the most easily superseded property. Fire elementals are generally not remarkable as post-Quest pets, so the invoke effect is typically not of much use. A light source that is never put out by, e.g. engulfing or rust traps is a major plus as well. For other neutral roles, this artifact is generally not worth using a wish on.
